p.s: The limits of my language are the limits of my world.
This is a quotation from Ludwig Wittgenstein a German linguist philosopher in the years 1889 to 1951.
I think that this quotation fits partly.
On one hand language is pretty important for example in a diffrentdifferent country.
It is nearly impossible to get along without knowing the countryscountry's language at all.
But it is not impossible, sure it is hard but sometimes people can understand each other without talking.
But I see Ludwig Wittgenstein's point.
It is not easy to get a job etc. if you can notcannot communicate with others.
Besides the social livelife suffer, if you can not communicate with others.
It is known that the human needs social contacts, so it would not be good for his psyche.

So in general I agree with Ludwig Wittgenstein, but not completlycompletely, because I think it is important to know languages to get along in the world, but language does not limit our world completlycompletely.
